programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.sub-title: I'm a Celebrity Legends of the Castle
programme.desc: Ant and Dec present a one-off special combining highlights from the latest series with interviews from the famous faces taking part after they left Gwrych Castle in Abergele on the North Wales coast.

programme.title: FYI Extra
programme.desc: Short bulletin rounding up the day's showbusiness stories.

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: It's the grand finale and one act will walk away with half a million pounds. The champion faces four new challengers all performing to try and win the audience vote and take home that prize. Maya Jama hosts the musical game show in which acts compete for a prize pot of Â£500,000, with Gary Barlow, Alesha Dixon, Dawn French and Craig David judging.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection.

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Crossing words today are sisters from London Nenna and Bavita, Milly and her dad Barry from Wakefield, and Mike and his mum Vicky from Cardiff. Quiz, hosted by Adil Ray.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Anna is training to be a magician with Dave as her helpful assistant, but their disappearing trick is not up to much - that is, until Zombie Katie bestows a magic spell book upon them. Soon they can't stop making stuff disappear, but what will happen when there is nothing left to make disappear in Grimsby?.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Lil Sue has started a delivery company called Deliver Sue, and in a quest to raise money for a new set of wheels, Dave lands himself with a job - Anna thinks she knows how to deliver packages quicker than Dave, though, and a dramatic sibling rivalry soon unfolds..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The misadventures of underdog Dave Spud and his family. Dave is thrilled when he wins an electronic home help device called Barry - finally, his family can boss something around other than him, but it is not long before Barry is overwhelmed by the Spuds' demands. Fighting back, Barry takes over Grimsby Heights and heads off to the sea for some well-earned peace and quiet..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Global warming becomes a very real problem for a family trapped in a city that is being overtaken by rising ocean tides. With little time remaining, Gordon and Kayo race to the rescue. Adventure series, with the voices of David Menkin and Angel Coulby.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Fast flowing waters await Danny in today's dare as he takes on a white-water rafting course including the UK's steepest man-made drop..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Stephan has lost his keys, and in spite of Mike's offer to find them he isn't convinced the pug has what it takes..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike's worst nightmare comes true when Louise finds a terrifying old toy at the bottom of her toy trunk..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless bumbler tries to retrieve his credit card from a cash dispenser, but ends up trapped in a bank vault. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless bumbler goes on a one-man mission to clean up the town after becoming furious with the state of the streets and all the people who drop litter. Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood films. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo can't find the book that Linda lent him and he's ready to turn the house upside down to find it. The problem is that he's actually in Fizz's loft..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo, thinking he's at the laundromat, wanders into a candy factory, where Fizz and Weasel are creating a bubblegum that makes Fizz-shaped bubbles..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Team Tennyson travel to the new Laser Town VR but when Kevin cheats his way to the top, Ben must team up with former champ Fang if he is going to defeat his souped-up rival.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: When a mysterious devise attaches itself to his wrist, 10-year old Ben Tennyson suddenly develops the ability to transform into various alien beings, all with different exceptional and unique powers. Join Ben as he battles various enemies and learns the responsibilities of being a hero.

programme.title: LEGO Marvel Superheroes
programme.sub-title: LEGO Marvel Super Heroes: Avengers Reassembled
programme.desc: Ultron gains control of Iron Man's armour and uses it to wreak havoc on the world, so the Avengers try to stop him and save Iron Man in the process.

programme.title: How
programme.desc: Vick Hope, Sam Homewood, Frankie Vu and Fred Dinenage ask questions beginning with the word How. Join the team in the HOW Hub as Frankie proves how a car can clean up, Doctor HOW makes brilliantly bright bears, Vick explains just how pants a shooting star can be, and Fred keeps everyone in suspense as he asks how a box can keep you guessing!.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.sub-title: James Martin's Saturday Morning at Christmas
programme.desc: James serves up dishes for All Creatures Great and Small stars Samuel West and Anna Madeley, and there are recipes from Galton Blackiston and the Ritz's head chef John Williams.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Cookery show with John Torode and Lisa Faulkner, featuring recipes, shortcuts, inspiration and tips.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in the semi-final of the obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK. With brand new obstacles to face, the course is more extreme than ever, as the best competitors from four heats return to fight it out for a place in the final.

programme.title: Johnny English Reborn (2011)
programme.desc: A bumbling secret agent retires to a Tibetan monastery in disgrace after a mission goes wrong. He is lured out of seclusion by the chance to redeem himself when his former bosses seek his help in foiling an attempt to assassinate the premier of China. Spy comedy sequel, starring Rowan Atkinson, Gillian Anderson, Rosamund Pike and Dominic West.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents a compilation of outtakes and laughs from the quiz show, featuring regular chasers the Governess, the Beast, the Vixen, the Sinnerman and the Dark Destroyer.

programme.title: The Brits Are Coming
programme.desc: Maya Jama and Clara Amfo announce the nominations for the BRIT Awards 2022. Alongside the reveal of shortlists, the show features performances from Anne-Marie, Glass Animals, Mimi Webb and Joel Corry & Mabel.

programme.title: Rolling in It
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a special Christmas edition of the game show where everything can change on the roll of a coin. Anton Du Beke, Ranvir Singh and Catherine Tyldesley join three members of the public who will try to win thousands of pounds. All they have to do is take on one of the biggest arcade games in the world, but will one of them be lucky enough to hit the jackpot and go home Rolling In It?.

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: Killian, Shivanni and Ishmail take part in the game show hosted by Ian Wright, answering questions to try to bank money by dropping a ball from the Launcher onto an amount of cash. The money up for grabs continues to climb but so does the pressure as one final ball needs to be played - the Moneyball - that could see a player leaving with their hard-earned prize or going home with nothing.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Mark Chapman, Gillian Joseph, Ryan Sidebottom and Fred MacAulay pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Saturday Night Line Up
programme.sub-title: Paul O'Grady's Saturday Night Christmas Line Up
programme.desc: A festive edition of the comedy chat and game show in which Paul puts questions, scenarios and dilemmas to celebrity guests Dame Joan Collins, Paddy McGuinness, Sunetra Sarker and Julian Clary, who must arrange themselves from best to worst correctly to match the order the British public have put them in.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: Jonathan introduces a festive edition of the chat show, and is joined by The Chase presenter Bradley Walsh, comedian and actress Roisin Conaty, Hollywood star Andrew Garfield and Bafta Award winner Tom Hollander. Music comes from Leona Lewis, who also joins the host for a chat.

programme.title: Strictly the Real Full Monty
programme.desc: Ashley Banjo leads a line-up of celebrities ready to recreate the famous striptease scene from the film to raise awareness of life-saving cancer checks. He helps Laila Morse, James Jordan, Duncan James, Christine McGuinness, Colin Jackson, Brenda Edwards, Martin Roberts, Teddy Soares and Demi Jones prepare for a musical dance extravaganza in front of an audience in Blackpool's famous ballroom.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys decides Arkwright needs a lesson in politeness, and convinces him a writer for the Good Shop Guide is doing the rounds. She then poses as the critic to see for herself the unusual sight of the miserly shopkeeper being nice to his customers. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: The Mystical Boudoir of Nurse Gladys Emmanuel
programme.desc: Arkwright hatches a plan to get into Nurse Gladys's bedroom by forcing a reluctant Granville to masquerade as a burglar, so the miserly shopkeeper can come to her rescue. Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron star.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: An insight into a team of engineers in Perth's attempts to not only break the 763mph land speed record set back in 1997, but also go past the 1,000mph barrier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look onboard the $200million Black Pearl, which is the largest sailing yacht in the world and has been built to sail faster than any ship of its size.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: How the world's biggest ship, designed to install oil platforms and lay pipelines, was inspired by a logging machine, a wire rope and 1940s shipbuilding techniques.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: The underground bases built by the German army during the occupation of Jersey, and a group of more than 20 underground cities in Turkey, one of which dates back to 800BC.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: White Pass and Yukon Railroad - The Gold Rush Railway
programme.desc: The White Pass and Yukon Railroad over the US-Canada border, which began construction after the Klondike Gold Rush in the late 19th century and saw 35 workers lose their lives.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: Kiruna to Narvik - Hitler's Arctic Railway Line
programme.desc: The Nordland Line, the longest in Norway at 453 miles. Stretching between Trondheim and Bodo, it was first built to transport the country's greatest natural resource - iron ore.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Liverpool to Manchester Line - The First Modern Railway
programme.desc: The Liverpool and Manchester Railway, which revolutionised rail travel when it opened in 1830, becoming the first railway to have a signalling system among many other things.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Tablelands Railways Line - Jungle Secrets
programme.desc: The Tablelands Railway Line in Queensland, Australia, which changed the face of one of the country's great states when it was constructed in the late 1800s.

programme.title: Great British Landmark Fixers
programme.desc: Salt water and iron don't mix and Southend Pier, built back in 1888, has seen better days. Now a team of specialists are working hard to prevent it falling into the sea.

programme.title: Hornby: A Model World
programme.desc: The Scalextric team attempt to tap into the brand's glory years, the 1980s, and devise a plan to create a model of a classic supercar, the Lamborghini Countach.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey up the west coast of Scotland and discovers how trains helped spread the reputation of Oban whisky. He also learns about the efforts to build a railway through the desolate Rannoch Moor and visits Corrour, a favourite shooting estate of the political elite in Victorian times.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey from Ayr to Skye and investigates the parallel 'roads' etched in the side of Glen Roy - one of the geological mysteries of the 19th century. He also finds out how the Victorians put a weather observatory on the top of Ben Nevis, and crosses the Glenfinnan viaduct by steam train.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In the final leg of his journey from Ayr to Skye, Michael Portillo discovers how the railways provided Second World War commandos with the means to travel to the isolated landscape of Lochailort, where they were able to train without attracting the attention of German spies. He also learns why langoustines have replaced herring as the best catch in the fishing port of Mallaig, and explores the history of Highland crofters.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo learns more about the country's railways, beginning with the Great Eastern Line, which runs along the edge of England and into central London. On his travels, the former politician discovers the grave-robbing history of Great Yarmouth and tries his hand at working a Victorian swing bridge in Reedham, Norfolk. He also takes to the air to reveal how a rail guidebook helped aviators during the Second World War.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey along the Great Eastern Line, which ventures from the edge of England to the heart of London. In this leg, he examines the Victorians' fascination with the Suffolk village of Dunwich, Britain's answer to Atlantis, and discovers how nearby Felixstowe became home to the UK's biggest container port.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits the sites of Victorian freak shows, rides one of the world's first electric railways in Southend and encounters the preserved head of a medieval politician as he continues his journey along the route of the Great Eastern Line.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Epping, Essex, to Hackney in north-east London, discovering why dairy herds were transported by train all over Britain. He also finds out the importance of the gunpowder trade to Waltham Cross, and learns the gruesome details of the first murder to take place on a train.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues to follow the route of the Great Eastern Line, enjoying a ride on a miniature railway hidden beneath London. During his trip, he also rings the bells of Bow Church, and tries his hand at announcing at Fenchurch Street station.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo retraces railway journeys made by Queen Victoria in the south of England, where she would travel from Windsor Castle in Berkshire to her summer retreat on the Isle of Wight. The first leg of the trip takes him from Windsor's railway station to Didcot in Oxfordshire, stopping along the way to view a structure designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel in Maidenhead. He also tries to collect the mail in the manner of Victorian postal workers on a steam-powered travelling post office.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's tour takes him to Alton, Hampshire, where he samples Victorian super food, explores Whitchurch Silk Mill, which has remained untouched for more than 150 years, and drives a steam train on the challenging Watercress Line.

programme.title: Open All Hours

programme.desc: It's Christmas at River Cottage and Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall is throwing open his doors to some celebrity friends - comedy stars Kathy Burke, Stephen Mangan and Mark Heap. Hugh takes Kathy out on a fishing trip to catch an alternative Christmas Day main course - perfect for non-meat eaters like her, or anyone fancying a change from turkey. Resident forager John Wright heads to the woods in search of wild mushrooms and oak moss for a seasonal starter, and chefs Tim Maddams and Gill Meller demonstrate how to prepare cocktails, breads and trays of vegetables.

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: It's Christmas and Hugh's plan is to shoot, harvest, gather and cook enough food to furnish the tables for a magnificent medieval festive banquet..

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall challenges his two chefs to create a new recipe using Brussels sprouts, and a butcher shows how to find the most tender cuts in the forequarter of a cow. The cook also goes hunting for sika deer, to be used in a venison roast, and creates a flaming jam roly-poly using the fat from a cow's kidney.

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: River Cottage welcomes the festive season with a Christmas Fayre as Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and his team share their secrets on how to enjoy the perfect Christmas holiday..

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall challenges his two chefs to create a new recipe using Brussels sprouts, and a butcher shows how to find the most tender cuts in the forequarter of a cow. The cook also goes hunting for sika deer, to be used in a venison roast, and creates a flaming jam roly-poly using the fat from a cow's kidney.

programme.title: Jamie's Family Christmas
programme.desc: In a festive-themed five-part show, Jamie Oliver shares his secrets for achieving a stress-free family Christmas, providing viewers with fool-proof recipes, tips on getting ready for the big meal, and advice on making good use of all the leftover food once December 25 has passed. In the first programme, Jamie demonstrates how to prepare the perfect turkey.

programme.title: Jamie's Family Christmas
programme.desc: With his tips on serving up the turkey out of the way, Jamie Oliver turns his attention to brunches, lunches and snacks to stave off hunger during the festive season. He prepares roasted squash and seared beef carpaccio salad, and is joined by his daughters Poppy and Daisy to make American-style pancakes.

programme.title: Jamie's Family Christmas
programme.desc: Gennaro Contaldo joins the chef to show how to make the most of Christmas vegetables, focusing on roasted spuds, parsnips and carrots. Jamie also experiments with olive oil, butter and goose fat to find the best way to achieve the perfect roast potato, and later makes a vegetable roast, before offering tips on how to use leftovers.

programme.title: Jamie's Best Ever Christmas
programme.desc: Two-part special brought to life with animation, in which Jamie Oliver presents his favourite festive recipes. In the first edition, the chef focuses on Christmas Day food, demonstrating how to prepare a traditional turkey dinner with roast potatoes, gravy and vegetables. He also offers tips on making desserts including chocolate truffles and mince pies, as well as mulled wine.

programme.title: Jamie's Christmas with Bells On
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver gives budding cooks a hand by demonstrating a selection of traditional dishes and fun party food for the festive season. In the first of two programmes, he focuses on preparation, revealing how a little planning before the big day can avoid common disasters, such as turkeys that are still frozen and exploding Christmas puddings. He also introduces a few new ideas, including jerk ham hock and hot rummy lemonade.

programme.title: Jamie's Ultimate Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver has been cooking and experimenting with classic Christmas food for over two decades and this programme pulls together his knowledge and experience to bring the very best of the season. He begins with what he calls the three foundations of Christmas, with guests will forgiving any mistakes as long as the turkey is succulent, the gravy is tasty, and the roast potatoes are perfect, and serves the main course with Brussels sprouts done with chorizo and chestnuts, and glazed carrots. Jamie also shares some other dishes, including gravadlax steeped in a beetroot, horseradish and vodka marinade, as well as gooey chocolate pots, turkey risotto, cocktails, and a classic beef Wellington.

programme.title: All-Star Gingerbread Build
programme.desc: Festive one-off special in which Ron Ben-Israel and Jonathan Scott face off against Duff Goldman and Drew Scott to create a life-sized gingerbread house in just 72 hours.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick judge finds his principles tested by the offer of a place on the Appellate Bench in return for hushing up a diplomatic incident. Convinced that an Arab sheikh's driver is covering for his boss over the murder of a prostitute, he is forced to decide whether to see justice done or yield to the temptation of the bribe and back off in the 'national interest'. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.sub-title: Are You Being Served? Special Christmas 1979
programme.desc: The staff of Grace Brothers stage a life-size Punch and Judy show to entertain a group of their colleagues' children. Christmas special of the vintage comedy, starring John Inman.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Jo takes on a distressing case in which a waste incinerator company is accused of deliberately hiding a design fault, with harmful consequences for the community. Meanwhile, the home secretary is accused of accepting a bribe - but the evidence goes missing, enabling him to call for Deed's impeachment. Starring Martin Shaw, with Jenny Seagrove and Aneirin Hughes.

programme.desc: The success of a new business venture causes Sharon and Tracey's lives to take a new direction. Meanwhile, Dorien advises a depressed Garth, who's desperate to find out what life's all about. With Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: With the swimming pool enterprise beginning to pick up increased trade, Sharon tries to get Chris to agree to sign over his half of the cafe business so she can sell it on. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon and Tracey have a new sideline in double-glazing, and a new, ruthless saleswoman in Dorien. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.desc: A 1983 Christmas edition. James returns to Darrowby after being demobbed from the army. Rural drama, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Peter Davison.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives of Nonnatus House return, with new nurse Barbara, who is anxious to prove herself - only to get off on the wrong foot after a late-night drinks party. A family of severely neglected children is discovered, so Trixie strives to restore their health and bring happiness into their lives, leaving Tom filled with admiration for the woman he loves, while Sister Evangelina finally undergoes tests for her abdominal pains. Shelagh finds she is at the surgery almost as much as she is at home, so the Turners come up with a solution which, for 1960, proves somewhat ground-breaking.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara faces her most challenging case so far when she treats a first-time mother, only for the birth not to go according to plan. A new nurse arrives and soon makes an impression on Sister Evangelina, while Sister Julienne is worried about the increasing financial pressure on Nonnatus House, but doesn't bank on a mystery benefactor coming to the rescue. Jenny Agutter and Pam Ferris star, with Linda Bassett (East Is East) joining the cast.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is gripped by an outbreak of dysentery, but that's the least of mum-to-be Marie Amos's worries when her husband Tony is arrested for gross indecency in the gentlemen's toilets and faces a criminal hearing. Nurse Crane meets Dolores McEvoy, a pregnant Irish woman who is clearly malnourished - but when she visits the woman's home, it turns out she has given a false address and has disappeared. Trixie is delighted when Tom asks her to oversee her first official church duty since their engagement, while at Nonnatus House, Fred tackles a rat infestation - only for Sister Monica Joan to work against him. With guest appearances by Cara Theobold (Downton Abbey) and Richard Fleeshman (Coronation Street).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Winifred's eyes are opened to Poplar's seedy underworld when she cares for expectant prostitute Bridget Cole. Horrified by the young woman's lack of awareness, she draws on her teaching experience, and with help from Sgt Noakes sets out to promote safe sex to all local working girls. Barbara struggles to understand why expectant father Frank Robbins would pressure his wife to bear him a son, while Sister Monica Joan is feeling sidelined - until she finds herself unexpectedly assisting Shelagh with an emergency birth. Trixie invites herself along to a meeting between Tom and the Bishop - but things get tense when the idea of the couple moving to Newcastle is raised.

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The case of renowned Alaskan gold miner and outspoken political activist Joe Vogler, who vanished from his remote Fairbanks home in 1993. Police found his residence undisturbed with no evidence of foul play, but his allies refused to give up their search, forcing authorities to consider such theories as murder, a government conspiracy or even alien abduction.
